snippet.textDisplay:
Story battles of which this music is heard:
1. The first battle outside Orbonne Monastery
2. Algus/Argath's betrayal during the battle at Fort Zeakden
3. Battle at Goug Slums
4. Delita and Ovelia Vs Two Ninjas (WOTL only)
5. Zalmo's last battle in Zeltennia
6. Battle against Rofel at the 2nd floor underground storage of Orbonne Monastery.
snippet.textOriginal:
Story battles of which this music is heard:
1. The first battle outside Orbonne Monastery
2. Algus/Argath's betrayal during the battle at Fort Zeakden
3. Battle at Goug Slums
4. Delita and Ovelia Vs Two Ninjas (WOTL only)
5. Zalmo's last battle in Zeltennia
6. Battle against Rofel at the 2nd floor underground storage of Orbonne Monastery.

snippet.textDisplay:
I always get amused by how this huge, climatic sounding music plays for a tutorial fight against a bunch of easily dispatched nobodies.  You'd think this was the last fight in the game or some shit.

But in all seriousness, this game was an instant classic.  You knew when you heard this playing for the first fight in the game you were in for something special.
snippet.textOriginal:
I always get amused by how this huge, climatic sounding music plays for a tutorial fight against a bunch of easily dispatched nobodies.  You'd think this was the last fight in the game or some shit.

But in all seriousness, this game was an instant classic.  You knew when you heard this playing for the first fight in the game you were in for something special.

snippet.textDisplay: I've beaten this game so many times I've lost count. Would give anything for a sequel, not like Tactics Advance, but an actual continuation of the story with Ramza. Or maybe a prequel with Ramza's dad, Balbanes, back in his younger days. Or maybe a spin-off with Delita as the main character playing through his side of the story. That would be badass.
snippet.textOriginal: I've beaten this game so many times I've lost count. Would give anything for a sequel, not like Tactics Advance, but an actual continuation of the story with Ramza. Or maybe a prequel with Ramza's dad, Balbanes, back in his younger days. Or maybe a spin-off with Delita as the main character playing through his side of the story. That would be badass.

snippet.textDisplay:
I've only watched my cousins play the first mission of this game, and the music stuck in my head, every time I emulated a Tactics Ogre game, this song played in my head. Any time I imagined a Tactics Ogre scenario or any game based thereof, *this song played in my head.*

Thanks to games like this and Far Cry 4, I think it might be rule of thumb that the mission of defending a monastery might have some kickass OST. (Look up "Cultural Exchange Far Cry 4", and find a silent walkthrough. You'll see what I mean)
snippet.textOriginal:
I've only watched my cousins play the first mission of this game, and the music stuck in my head, every time I emulated a Tactics Ogre game, this song played in my head. Any time I imagined a Tactics Ogre scenario or any game based thereof, *this song played in my head.*

Thanks to games like this and Far Cry 4, I think it might be rule of thumb that the mission of defending a monastery might have some kickass OST. (Look up "Cultural Exchange Far Cry 4", and find a silent walkthrough. You'll see what I mean)

snippet.textDisplay: Having finished this for a 2nd time yesterday, I think I like XIV more with this being a close 2nd. Chapter 4, from a gameplay standpoint, is terrible. Orlandu is way too overpowered and with every fight being "DEFEAT THIS PERSON" the game just becomes way too easy. XIV, to me, is the ultimate FF especially for anyone who favors the High Fantasy/Job System entries
snippet.textOriginal: Having finished this for a 2nd time yesterday, I think I like XIV more with this being a close 2nd. Chapter 4, from a gameplay standpoint, is terrible. Orlandu is way too overpowered and with every fight being "DEFEAT THIS PERSON" the game just becomes way too easy. XIV, to me, is the ultimate FF especially for anyone who favors the High Fantasy/Job System entries

snippet.textDisplay: I love how well they blended together the music of XII and Tactics given they take place in the same world. Does anyone know if the same composer of tactics also compose the music of XII?
snippet.textOriginal: I love how well they blended together the music of XII and Tactics given they take place in the same world. Does anyone know if the same composer of tactics also compose the music of XII?

snippet.textDisplay: if you liked the OSTs for tactics and XII, then you should also check out the ones for tactics advance and tactics advance 2. also many reused tracks and an overall very similiar style since its also done by hitoshi sakimoto. also i can recommend the valkyria chronicles soundtrack (not a final fantasy game but OST is also by hitoshi sakimoto and reminds me alot of the tactics games !)
snippet.textOriginal: if you liked the OSTs for tactics and XII, then you should also check out the ones for tactics advance and tactics advance 2. also many reused tracks and an overall very similiar style since its also done by hitoshi sakimoto. also i can recommend the valkyria chronicles soundtrack (not a final fantasy game but OST is also by hitoshi sakimoto and reminds me alot of the tactics games !)

snippet.textDisplay:
The composers for both game are indeed the same person. Hitoshi Sakimoto (I know that he did Tactics but I don't think that he was alone on XII).

I love his sound as well. :3

I have not heard all of his music but I want to share 2 pieces of his music that I really love. Check out Attic of the Great Cathedral from Vagrant Story and  "A Fate Accepted" from Odin Sphere (again I don't think it's him alone but he had his hand in it).

I hope you enjoy and keep on listening.
snippet.textOriginal:
The composers for both game are indeed the same person. Hitoshi Sakimoto (I know that he did Tactics but I don't think that he was alone on XII).

I love his sound as well. :3

I have not heard all of his music but I want to share 2 pieces of his music that I really love. Check out Attic of the Great Cathedral from Vagrant Story and  "A Fate Accepted" from Odin Sphere (again I don't think it's him alone but he had his hand in it).

I hope you enjoy and keep on listening.

snippet.textDisplay:
If anyone wants a true challenge, go find the Final Fantasy Tactics 1.3 mod. Rebalanced things, altered some skills especially Black Magic, and made the AI god mode. You must truly outplay them and have strategy to win. 

Have to pay attention to CT and speeds of characters to prevent enemies revive chaining, weighing your odds of success Curse Striking enemies for Oil+Poison with archers so you can use explosion/comet to delete them, etc.

Anyone who truly gets into the FFT gameplay should love this mod. It really stretches your skills and planning to win fights.
snippet.textOriginal:
If anyone wants a true challenge, go find the Final Fantasy Tactics 1.3 mod. Rebalanced things, altered some skills especially Black Magic, and made the AI god mode. You must truly outplay them and have strategy to win. 

Have to pay attention to CT and speeds of characters to prevent enemies revive chaining, weighing your odds of success Curse Striking enemies for Oil+Poison with archers so you can use explosion/comet to delete them, etc.

Anyone who truly gets into the FFT gameplay should love this mod. It really stretches your skills and planning to win fights.

snippet.textDisplay: I want a new FF Tactics soooo bad. It would be amazing to see a return to the darker, more mature themed style. I'm okay with the light heartedness of the later tactics games but off setting it with more of a grim story would be a nice balance if they still want to cater to a young audience alongside us.. aged players. Lol

snippet.textDisplay: I've played tons of SRPGs, but out of all them I'd say the original Final Fantasy Tactics was, and still is, the most hardest. And I enjoy it because of that. FFTA is pretty much the only game in the bunch of strategic role-playing games that truly lives up to its genre.

snippet.textDisplay:
This game, even today, is the definition of Cutting the Edge.

Phenominal Music, even by today's standards.
Plotline is fantastic, and even disturbing.  Banned in some places for it's religious overtones, and various "realities".
Gameplay was entertaining, and you get to use control the most over powered character ever designed.  T.G.Cid makes the game to easy.  :p

The characters are fantastic, the story is equally so.  The music is a bonus, and could have made the game on it's own.
snippet.textOriginal:
This game, even today, is the definition of Cutting the Edge.

Phenominal Music, even by today's standards.
Plotline is fantastic, and even disturbing.  Banned in some places for it's religious overtones, and various "realities".
Gameplay was entertaining, and you get to use control the most over powered character ever designed.  T.G.Cid makes the game to easy.  :p

The characters are fantastic, the story is equally so.  The music is a bonus, and could have made the game on it's own.

snippet.textDisplay:
Burning Anger Rising... Burst! Wave Fist!  
Armor won't help the heart stay sharp! Shellbust Stab! 
Destiny lies in my hands! Stop movement! Galaxy stop! 
Inscript the dark god into a rotting body! Flare! 
Kupo! Round and round you go! Moogle! 
And this game had one of these awesome phrases for every spell.  Too cool.
snippet.textOriginal:
Burning Anger Rising... Burst! Wave Fist!  
Armor won't help the heart stay sharp! Shellbust Stab! 
Destiny lies in my hands! Stop movement! Galaxy stop! 
Inscript the dark god into a rotting body! Flare! 
Kupo! Round and round you go! Moogle! 
And this game had one of these awesome phrases for every spell.  Too cool.

snippet.textDisplay:
hahaha, I actually spent alot of frustration and time trying to figure out if there was a "secret" way of getting Ramza to become a Holy Knight. I remember seeing Delita become a Holy Knight, and was like WTF!!! Little did I know that it was all due to plot. 

It sorta did give me a greater appreciation for the game though, because for once in an RPG the main character does not get any special abilities. (aside from Guts, but Guts is sorta meagre compared to the Holy Knight)
snippet.textOriginal:
hahaha, I actually spent alot of frustration and time trying to figure out if there was a "secret" way of getting Ramza to become a Holy Knight. I remember seeing Delita become a Holy Knight, and was like WTF!!! Little did I know that it was all due to plot.

snippet.textDisplay: @FanofniceGameMusic Agreed wholeheartedly. This game shaped me as a person. I literally grew up with this game, and I don't think I'll ever outlive the impact it has had on me. My appreciation for storytelling, for music, for games and gameplay, for even moral or general values, were all shaped by this game. Hearing this reminds me of the first time I loaded it up and played it. "Don't blame us. Blame yourself, or God."
snippet.textOriginal: @FanofniceGameMusic Agreed wholeheartedly. This game shaped me as a person. I literally grew up with this game, and I don't think I'll ever outlive the impact it has had on me. My appreciation for storytelling, for music, for games and gameplay, for even moral or general values, were all shaped by this game. Hearing this reminds me of the first time I loaded it up and played it. "Don't blame us. Blame yourself, or God."

snippet.textDisplay: Some people complained about the sound quality of the music. And it's simple really, The original was Sequenced sound played through the Playstation using Effects like Reverb. The sound is essentially the same minus the Reverb. This is what the sound samples sounded like RAW. And they did this for an obvious reason. With all the reverb listening through just the psp speaker you wouldn't be able to hear all the instruments clearly. They didn't do it with Full Stereo in mind
snippet.textOriginal: Some people complained about the sound quality of the music. And it's simple really, The original was Sequenced sound played through the Playstation using Effects like Reverb. The sound is essentially the same minus the Reverb. This is what the sound samples sounded like RAW. And they did this for an obvious reason. With all the reverb listening through just the psp speaker you wouldn't be able to hear all the instruments clearly. They didn't do it with Full Stereo in mind

My brothers and I poured hundreds of hours into this game.

snippet.textDisplay: BEST TUNE IN THE GAME!!!!!!!!! GO FFT!
snippet.textOriginal: BEST TUNE IN THE GAME!!!!!!!!! GO FFT!

snippet.textDisplay:
Yeah, this music made slaughtering him really epic! I had Delita deliver the last blow on him and I laughed hysterically when Algus passed out. It still was quite a shock to see him betray Ramza and killing Teta. But that's what made the plot so great. Twists. 

Gosh, it must be about 10 years since I first played this. I'm one of the few in Finland that have played the original Tactics. My Playstation was modded to support American releases and FFT became one of my treasures. I'm so lucky! :)
snippet.textOriginal:
Yeah, this music made slaughtering him really epic! I had Delita deliver the last blow on him and I laughed hysterically when Algus passed out. It still was quite a shock to see him betray Ramza and killing Teta. But that's what made the plot so great. Twists. 

Gosh, it must be about 10 years since I first played this. I'm one of the few in Finland that have played the original Tactics. My Playstation was modded to support American releases and FFT became one of my treasures. I'm so lucky! :)
